availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

body.p: Grayson County, Kentucky, miller. Indiana native. Married to Eliza A. Winchel. Father of Ira C. Winchel, John F. Winchel, William M. Winchel, Charles E. Winchel, Roxey Winchel, Uriah F. Winchel, and Edwin F. Winchel. Miller in Grayson County in 1850 and 1860. Operated a mill on Rough Creek in 1858.

bibl.p: Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Grayson County, p. 65A. Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Grayson County, p. 55. "An Act for the Benefit of Uriah Winchel," Acts of the General Assembly of the Commonwealth of Kentucky, vol. 2 (Frankfort, Ky.: George D. Prentice, State Printer, 1858), 331.
